name: Structural Insulated Panel (SIP)
description: Structural Insulated Panels (SIP) consisting of oriented strand board (OSB) faces with insulated core, designed for structural applications in building construction. Panels are capable of withstanding design loads including dead load, live loads, wind loads and seismic loads.

loadBearingCapacity.loadDistribution: Dead loads, live loads, wind loads, seismic loads

documentationAndCompliance.technicalSpecifications: ASTM C578 for EPS core, ASTM D2559 for adhesive

installationAndConnectivity.connectionType: Panel joints with expanding urethane foam or approved sealing method
installationAndConnectivity.compatibility: Compatible with lumber: Spruce-Pine-Fir, Hem-Fir, Douglas Fir-Larch, Southern Pine

lifecycleAndMaintenance.maintenanceRequirements: Must be kept dry and protected with waterproof covering

aestheticAndCustomizationOptions.modularAdaptability: Can be cut to accurate lengths, angles, and sizes

additionalSpecifications.installerRequirements: Minimum 3 years experience or certified SIP training program completion

fasteners.screws: Pancake head, min thread diameter 0.255", min shank diameter 0.190", min head diameter 0.625"
